label: native: reintroduced
definition: A taxon re-established by direct introduction by humans into an area that was once part of its natural range, but from where it had become extinct.
notes: Where a taxon has become extirpated from an area where it had naturally occurred it may be returned to that area deliberately with the intention of re-establishing it.

label: native: endemic
definition: A taxon with a natural distribution restricted to a single geographical area.
notes: The term endemic is a subcategory of native and relates to geography, such as "areas of endemism", bioregions, and sometimes administrative boundaries. While a native taxon can naturally occur in several geographical areas an endemic taxon only occurs in one. It would mean "the dwc:Organism referred to is recognized as a member of a dwc:Taxon endemic to the dcterms:Location at the time of the dwc:Occurrence."
